casebody.data:
STATE of North Carolina
v.
Amia Smith ERVIN No. 331P17 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 14, 2018 Mary McCullers Reece, Attorney at Law, Smithfield, for Ervin, Amia Smith. Narcisa Woods, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, N. Lorrin Freeman, District Attorney, for State of North Carolina.

ORDER

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 5th of October 2017 by State of NC for Temporary Stay:

"Motion Dissolved by order of the Court in conference, this the 14th of August 2018."

Upon consideration of the petition filed by State of NC on the 5th of October 2017 for Writ of Supersedeas of the judgment of the Court of Appeals, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 14th of August 2018."

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 24th of October 2017 by State of NC in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 14th of August 2018."
